summary: Reduces humanoid movement speed by 50% - 75% when backing up (walking or running backwards).  This affects the player and all NPC actors, monsters and animals are unaffected.  This is a simple mod that is compatible with nearly everything but will change the way you approach combat!  No more backpedaling your way to victory (unrealistic and not
descriptionHtml:
[center][color=#dbb0a7][b][size=5][font=Georgia]Backup Movement Speed Reduction[/font][/size][/b][/color][/center]

[u][color=#c9daf8][size=4][b][font=Times New Roman]Description[/font][/b][/size][/color][/u]

Reduces humanoid movement speed by 50% - 75% when backing up (walking or running backwards). This affects the player and all NPC actors; monsters and animals are unaffected. This is a simple mod that is compatible with nearly everything but will change the way you approach combat! No more backpedaling your way to victory which is unrealistic and not lore friendly!

This mod is script free, light, and touches no leveled lists or NPC records. It is unaffected by bashed patches, TES5Edit patches, and other compatibility patches.  No DLCs are required but the mod will affect all humanoid DLC actors as well as vanilla.  Forward, left, and right movement speeds were untouched and left at default.

I looked everywhere for a mod that would do this and couldn't find any so I wrote this mod. Most movement mods only affect the player; this one is different as it affects both the player and all humanoid actors. Realistic backup movement speed is now in your hands!


[u][color=#cfe2f3][size=4][b][font=Times New Roman]Compatibility[/font][/b][/size][/color][/u]

This is a simple and light-weight mod. It should be compatible with nearly everything. There are only two mods that I could find that even touch humanoid movement speeds and so this should be compatible with everything except mods that edit the same thing.  This mod should be fully compatible with all animation mods (no animations were added or modified).


[u][color=#c9daf8][size=4][b][font=Times New Roman]Load Order[/font][/b][/size][/color][/u]

Place this mod anywhere. Load order doesn't matter.


[u][color=#c9daf8][size=4][b][font=Times New Roman]Requirements[/font][/b][/size][/color][/u]

Skyrim version 1.9.32 or later


[u][color=#c9daf8][size=4][b][font=Times New Roman]Installation[/font][/b][/size][/color][/u]

1. Extract the contents of the 7z file
2. Copy the contents into your Skyrim's Data folder
3. Activate 'Backup Movement Speed Reduction.esp'


[u][color=#c9daf8][size=4][b][font=Times New Roman]Uninstallation[/font][/b][/size][/color][/u]

1. Remove 'Backup Movement Speed Reduction.esp' - Since this mod touches no NPC records or leveled lists it is generally safe to uninstall if you don't like the changes.


[img]http://files.enjin.com/631988/zzzPublicNexus/CombatEvolved/_10Banner-Recommended.jpg[/img]

Make sure that you install any needed mod requirements/dependencies and compatibility patches for the mods that you use. Please pay close attention to this! Follow ALL mod instructions for each mod that you install!

These are the Core mods that I run and have been running many of them for years without issue. The above mods I recommend without reservation and are generally solid and well written.



[center][img]http://files.enjin.com/631988/zzzPublicNexus/CombatEvolved/_11Banner-Recommended-powerful.jpg[/img][/center]

[b][color=#ff00ff][size=3]Highly Recommended System Specs[/size][/color][/b]:

[color=#f6b26b]Windows 7 64-bit or Windows 8 64-bit
Intel Core i7 Quad-Core or Intel Core i5 Dual or Quad Core Processor
8 GB DD3 RAM (or more)
Nvidia GeForce 580, 680, 770, 780, 970 or faster Video card with a minimum of 2 GB VRAM (3-6 GB VRAM is optimal)
Optimize your Skyrim setup using all of the advice in this guide[/color] - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/31793/?]How to Have the Best Modded Skyrim Experience[/url]

[b][color=#ff00ff]If you don't have the Optimal System Specs then choose 1K versions (whenever possible)[/color][/b].

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/62801/?]Vivid Landscapes - Tundra Region[/url] - 2K - install any patches that you want
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/62955/?]Lock o Motion[/url]

Make sure that you install any needed mod requirements/dependencies and compatibility patches for the mods that you use. Please pay close attention to this! Follow ALL mod instructions for each mod that you install!

These are the Core mods that I run and have been running many of them for years without issue. The above mods I recommend without reservation and are generally solid and well written.
